qas.question: About how many people lived in the Marshall Islands in 1862?
How many people lived in the Marshall Islands in 1960?
As of July 2011, how many people resided on the Marshall Islands?
On what atoll is Ebeye located?
What town hosts the largest number of Marshall Islanders outside the Marshall Islands?

context: Historical population figures are unknown. In 1862, the population was estimated at about <a0_0>10,000<a0_0/>. In 1960, the entire population was about <a1_0>15,000<a1_0/>. In July 2011, the number of island residents was estimated to number about <a2_0>72,191<a2_0/>. Over two-thirds of the population live in the capital, Majuro and Ebeye, the secondary urban center, located in <a3_0>Kwajalein Atoll<a3_0/>. This excludes many who have relocated elsewhere, primarily to the United States. The Compact of Free Association allows them to freely relocate to the United States and obtain work there. A large concentration of about 4,300 Marshall Islanders have relocated to <a4_0>Springdale, Arkansas<a4_0/>, the largest population concentration of natives outside their island home.
